Annotation.note:
The paper [BIB/Kalkbrener_93a] discusses solving polynomial systems by computing regular chains, i.e.. such triangular systems $(f_1,...,f_k)$ where $lc(f_i)(a_1,...,a_j)\neq 0$ on all zeroes $(a_1,...,a_j)\in Z(f_1,...f_{i-1})$. Employs a mixture between pseudo division and the D5 technique.
It discusses the following examples:
Cyclic_4 as 3.1. Trinks as (1) Katsura_5 as (2) Rose as (3) Czapor-86a as (4) Fee_1 as (5a) Fee_2 as (5b) Fee_3 as (5c) Czapor-86b as (6) Czapor-86c_1 as (7a) Czapor-86c_2 as (7b) Czapor-86c as (7c)
